era_1953_coup.title: The Original Sin: 1953 Coup

events.event: PM Mohammad Mossadegh nationalizes Iranian oil
events.significance: Defied British control of Anglo-Iranian Oil Company (now BP)

events.event: Operation AJAX: CIA/MI6 orchestrate coup against Mossadegh
events.significance: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi restored to power with Western backing

era_1953_coup.narrativeThread: This is the original sin of Western interference that Iranians never forgot. It planted the seeds for 1979. The regime still uses this to deflect: 'America is the real enemy.' TRUTH: The coup was wrong, but it doesn't justify 45 years of theocratic tyranny.
era_1953_coup.tweetAngle: History rhymes: In 1953, the West overthrew democracy. In 1979, they enabled theocracy. In 2026, will they finally support the people?

events.event: Mohammad Reza Shah takes throne after Anglo-Soviet invasion forces father's abdication
White Revolution launched: land reform, women's suffrage, literacy programs
events.significance: Modernization alienated traditional/religious elements

events.event: Ayatollah Khomeini exiled after criticizing Shah
events.significance: Sent to Iraq, then France - broadcast messages to incite supporters

events.event: 2,500th anniversary celebration of Persian monarchy at Persepolis
events.significance: Extravagant display criticized as wasteful

events.event: Shah secretly diagnosed with lymphoma/cancer
events.significance: Kept hidden - Western intelligence likely knew, may have influenced 1979 events

events.event: Qom protests after regime newspaper attacks Khomeini
events.significance: Beginning of revolutionary momentum

events.event: CINEMA REX FIRE - Abadan
events.description: Four Islamist militants barred doors and set fire to Cinema Rex, killing 377-470 people watching 'The Deer'
events.significance: Blamed on Shah/SAVAK by Khomeini, galvanized revolution. TRUTH: Islamists did it but regime got blamed
events.parallel2026: RASHT BAZAAR MASSACRE - Same regime, same tactics, 47 years later

events.event: Black Friday massacre at Jaleh Square, Tehran
events.significance: Hundreds killed, point of no return for Shah

events.event: GUADELOUPE CONFERENCE
events.description: Carter, Giscard d'Estaing, Callaghan, Schmidt meet in Caribbean
events.significance: Western allies concluded Shah could not be saved. Many Iranians believe this was where the West 'agreed' to let Shah fall
events.keyDetail: French intelligence director Yves Bonnet later revealed a fax from Khomeini aide Ghotbzadeh thanking Western leaders for their support

events.event: Shah leaves Iran for 'vacation' - never returns
events.significance: End of 2,500 years of Persian monarchy

events.event: Khomeini returns to Iran on Air France chartered flight
events.description: Arrived at Tehran's Mehrabad Airport to millions of supporters
events.significance: France hosted Khomeini in exile, facilitated his return

events.event: Revolution declared victorious
events.significance: Military declared neutrality, Bakhtiar government collapsed

events.event: Islamic Republic declared after referendum
events.significance: Rigged vote - only option was 'Islamic Republic: Yes or No'

counterRevolutionNarrative.source: Christopher Hitchens, Fred Halliday, Iranian leftists
counterRevolutionNarrative.thesis: The 1979 'revolution' was actually a COUNTER-REVOLUTION. The broad coalition that overthrew the Shah included leftists, liberals, nationalists, and Islamists. Khomeini systematically eliminated all non-Islamist elements.
evidence: 1979-1981: Purge of leftists, liberals, secular nationalists
1981-1982: Mass executions of MEK, Tudeh Party, other opposition - 3,400+ killed
Khomeini's Velayat-e Faqih doctrine: population treated as 'wards' of mullahs
counterRevolutionNarrative.tweetAngle: 1979 wasn't a revolution - it was a counter-revolution. Khomeini hijacked a popular uprising and murdered everyone who helped him. 2026 is the REAL revolution, 47 years delayed.

events.event: Shah admitted to US for cancer treatment
events.significance: After months of lobbying by Kissinger and Rockefeller, Carter allowed Shah into US

events.event: Iranian students storm US Embassy in Tehran
events.significance: 52 Americans held hostage for 444 days

events.event: Shah forced to leave US for Panama
events.significance: Carter administration hoped this would help free hostages - it didn't

events.event: Shah leaves Panama for Egypt
events.description: Refused surgery in Panama, feared poor medical care and extradition to Iran

events.event: Shah's spleen removed in Cairo by Dr. Michael DeBakey
events.significance: Only Anwar Sadat offered permanent asylum

events.event: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi dies in Cairo, age 60
events.significance: Buried in Al-Rifa'i Mosque alongside his brother-in-law King Farouk of Egypt

events.event: Hostages released after 444 days
events.significance: Released minutes after Reagan inaugurated - deliberate humiliation of Carter

path: Iran → Egypt → Morocco → Bahamas → Mexico → USA → Panama → Egypt (death)
shahExileJourney.betrayal: Every country that traded with Shah, maintained bank accounts, sold weapons - refused him asylum. Only Sadat stood by him.
shahExileJourney.tweetAngle: The Shah was abandoned by every 'ally' who profited from Iran. Only Sadat - who would himself be assassinated - gave him a home to die. Remember who stands with you when you fall.

events.event: Saddam Hussein invades Iran
events.significance: 8-year war, 1 million+ casualties

events.event: Khomeini accepts UN ceasefire - 'drinks poison chalice'
events.significance: Regime used war to consolidate power, eliminate internal opposition

events.event: 1988 PRISON MASSACRES
events.description: Khomeini orders mass execution of political prisoners. 5,000-30,000 killed in weeks. 'Death Commissions' systematically executed MEK, leftists, others.
events.significance: One of worst mass political executions in modern history - barely covered by Western media

events.event: Khomeini dies, Khamenei becomes Supreme Leader
Student protests crushed
Green Movement - millions protest stolen election
events.significance: Obama administration largely silent - pattern continues

events.event: JCPOA nuclear deal signed
Trump withdraws from JCPOA, 'Maximum Pressure' begins
'Bloody November' - 1,500+ killed in fuel protests
Qasem Soleimani killed by US drone strike
Mahsa Amini death sparks 'Woman, Life, Freedom' movement
12-day Israel-Iran tit-for-tat war
events.significance: 200+ missiles exchanged, Israeli strikes on Iranian military sites

events.event: Trump returns to office, signals support for Iranian people

era_2026_revolution.title: The 2026 Revolution - Completing What 1979 Began

events.event: Protests erupt at Tehran Grand Bazaar over economic collapse
events.significance: Bazaaris who helped 1979 revolution now turn against regime

events.event: Total internet blackout imposed
events.significance: 99% connectivity cut per NetBlocks

events.event: RASHT BAZAAR MASSACRE
events.description: Security forces surrounded protesters in bazaar, set fires, shot those trying to surrender or escape. Wounded 'finished off' in streets and hospitals.
events.parallel: CINEMA REX 1978: Islamists set fire to trap civilians, blamed Shah. RASHT 2026: Regime sets fire to trap civilians, blames protesters.

events.event: Khamenei speech calls protesters 'foreign rioters'
events.significance: Green light for mass violence

events.event: Iran International confirms 12,000+ civilians killed
Pahlavi calls for 3-day general strike Jan 18-20

era_2026_revolution.narrativeThread: This is the REAL revolution. 1979 was hijacked by Islamists who murdered everyone who helped them. For 47 years they've killed 150,000+ Iranians. Now the people are finishing what 1979 started: real freedom, real democracy, real Iran.

pahlavi_dynasty_continuity.title: Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi: 1960-2026

timeline.event: Born in Tehran, Crown Prince of Iran
Sent to US for pilot training, age 17
Father flees Iran - Reza never returns
Father dies in Cairo. Reza declares himself Shah in exile, later renounces title for constitutional monarchy
Decades in exile advocating for secular, democratic Iran
Prominent voice during Woman Life Freedom movement
Patrick Bet-David interview - disagreements on strategy
Emerges as leading opposition voice, calls for strikes and protests
timeline.significance: 'Javid Shah' chants in streets across Iran

pahlavi_dynasty_continuity.position: Advocates for secular democracy with constitutional monarchy option. Willing to serve as interim leader during transition. Has stated he would accept whatever form of government Iranians choose via free referendum.
pahlavi_dynasty_continuity.tweetAngle: For 47 years the Crown Prince waited. Now the people are calling him home. 'Javid Shah' echoes from Tehran to Mashhad. History completing its circle.

cinema_rex_vs_rasht_bazaar.title: The Fire Parallel: 1978 vs 2026

cinema_rex_1978.method: Barred doors, doused with airplane fuel, set ablaze
cinema_rex_1978.impact: Galvanized revolution, turned public against Shah
cinema_rex_1978.khomeini_statement: No pious Muslim could have done this - it was the Shah

rasht_bazaar_2026.method: Surrounded protesters, set fires blocking escape, shot those surrendering
rasht_bazaar_2026.victims: 70+ bodies at Poursina Hospital alone, many more unreported
rasht_bazaar_2026.actual_blame: IRGC and security forces - eyewitness testimony, video evidence
rasht_bazaar_2026.impact: Part of 12,000+ massacre, regime's true nature exposed

cinema_rex_vs_rasht_bazaar.narrative_connection: In 1978, Islamists burned 400 people alive and blamed the Shah. In 2026, the same Islamist regime burned protesters alive and blamed 'rioters.' The revolution has always been about these people - they just spent 47 years pretending to be something else.
